samples.context: In recent years, regulations such as the Montreal Protocol have been effective in phasing out substances that deplete the ozone layer, including chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs). Scientists have observed signs of recovery in the ozone layer as a result of these measures. The size of the ozone hole has been gradually decreasing, indicating that international efforts to control emissions are having a positive impact.
samples.question: What has the Montreal Protocol achieved?

samples.context: The depletion of the ozone layer has been linked to increases in ultraviolet radiation reaching the Earth. To counteract this, various countries implemented environmental regulations targeting ozone-depleting chemicals, including bans and usage limitations. Recent studies show these regulations are starting to reverse some of the ozone layer damage.
samples.question: What impact do regulations have on ozone depletion?
